author: gnnr25
body: eBay, Google, E\*Trade, Akamai, 3Com, etc. There were plenty of survivors, just a lot of casualties too.

author: necriss
body: Dot com bubble 2.0, this will be one of those stocks when it falls from all time high, it will never reach it again for the next 2 decades or more like QCOM and AKAM.

author: spacebizzle
body: NET has a $63B market cap, thats about the same as $FDX.  Except Fedex makes $86B in Revenue per year and $5B net income while NET does $173 mil per quarter.  This is how far from reality the market is for some stocks.  Even if you compare them to FSLY or AKAM its not even close.  AKAM trades at like 5 p/s, NET is at 111 p/s.  Big correction coming by next year imo.

author: doggy_lovers
body: what about Sentienelone, fortinet, palo alto networks, datadog, or some of the legacy akamai and fastly

author: ksumnole69
body: Can you share where you got your employee turnover data? I’ll do a comparison with AKAM and NET

author: oreverthrowaway
body: Akamai beat. do you feel fastly will move with industry avg? or it'll do the opposite

author: Hour_Amphibian1844
body: Linkedin Premium. But the data isn't that granular. You can't compare against a company like Akamai that's in a completely different stage. Cloudflare, maybe

author: ravivg
body: All big cloud providers have competing products and there are other companies like Fastly, Akamai, and many more.

author: TheGlassCat
body:
Many people saw that there was trouble ahead, but that didn't necessarily help anyone profit from their insight.     
Anecdote: Back in '99 I was a fervent reader of itulip.com which was predicting a crash followed by soring inflation. They got it half right. BTW, one of their biggest target of ridicule was a silly, pointless company called Akamai. They simply didn't understand the purpose of a CDN.

author: spacebizzle
body: They dont do much more than Akamai which makes like $3B a year and only a $17B market cap. FSLY is similar and only $5B.  You don’t think Microsoft or Google could eat these guys in a second if they wanted to?
